instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-02020: What is 820-02020? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> M1
threads.message: Where to start, comp working tryed different housing, trackpad and battery, still same, there may be issue with fan. And fan after turn on full speed

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> M1
threads.message:
Tried known good battery?
Test with external monitor, disconnecting internal LCD.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> M1
threads.message: Tryed another display m1 and tryed different batteries

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> M1
threads.message:
Run HWMonitor and check for strange values.
Check all components around UE501, QE500 and JE501.
Compare diode mode readings with good board.

Any history available?
Just in case, try DFU and full reinstall.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> M1
threads.message: Everything is clean around ue501, qe500, je501. was water spill. around the backlight area and speaker amplifer area.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> M1
threads.message:
Do all previous mentioned tests.

Tried with external monitor disconnecting internal LCD?
Also test disconnecting JR900.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> M1
threads.message: tryed disconnecting internal, same thing, and jr900 same thing, when boots it starts fan max

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> M1
threads.message:
Did you check the temps with HWMonitor?

Test the board in other shell; fan itself may be affected by corrosion.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> M1
threads.message: tested another shell and board, everything works, this mobo got problems.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> M1
threads.message:
"Check all components around UE501, QE500 and JE501.
Compare diode mode readings with good board."
